alert.note: Alert for Coastal Georgetown; Coastal Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued November 08 at 9:47PM EST until November 09 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST SATURDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 10 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 5 to 9 feet in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, one to two feet of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...In North Carolina, Coastal Pender and Coastal New Hanover Counties. In South Carolina, Coastal Horry and Coastal Georgetown Counties. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 10 AM EST Saturday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 5 AM to 10 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Low-lying roads and locations along the Intracoastal Waterway and adjacent tidal creeks may observe minor coastal flooding. Vulnerable causeways to and from local beaches will experience minor coastal flooding. Some roads may become impassable. Check with local officials for the latest information regarding coastal flood impacts and closures. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized minor beach erosion. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Springmaid Pier at Myrtle Beach MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 8.5 ft, Major 10.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 2.9 ft, Major 4.9 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 09/08 AM 8.3 2.7 2.1 6 Minor 09/08 PM 7.4 1.8 2.2 6 Minor 10/08 AM 8.0 2.4 2.0 6-7 Minor 10/09 PM 6.7 1.1 1.8 7 None 11/09 AM 7.2 1.6 1.5 7 Minor Mercer Pier at Wrightsville Beach MLLW Categories - Minor 6.0 ft, Moderate 8.0 ft, Major 10.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.5 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.5 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 09/07 AM 7.0 2.5 1.9 6 Minor 09/08 PM 5.9 1.4 1.8 7 None 10/08 AM 6.5 2.0 1.5 6 Minor 10/08 PM 5.1 0.6 1.3 6 None 11/09 AM 5.9 1.4 1.1 6-7 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
